request.description: Upload Notification

header.description: (Required) Unique company identifier associated with the Procore User Account.

formdata.description:
(Required) By setting a filename you ensure that the storage service knows the
filename of the upload. Files are often downloaded directly from the
storage service and without the filename they will save on the end
users' device without a readable name or extension.

The content-type set through this parameter will be used by the storage
service during download just like the response_filename. Setting this
value is less important because HTTP clients and operating systems are
generally well equipped to determine file types.

Setting this parameter is optional and should only be included when you
are certain it's correct or when you want to force a content-type other
than what the filename extension suggests.

The content type set through this parameter will be used by the storage system during download, similar to the response_filename. When set to true, the file will be downloaded as an attachment. Otherwise, the file content will be rendered inline in the browser.

request.description:
Creating an Upload is the first step in associating a file to a resource
in Procore. Creating an Upload can be seen as fetching instruction on how
to post your file directly to Procore's storage service.

The instructions contain three properties: a UUID to reference the
Upload, a URL which has to be used to post the file, and fields which
need to be posted together with the file.

To upload the file you must POST to the URL in the _url_ property with
a multipart/form-data body (see RFC 2388). Make sure to include **all**
the names and values from _fields_ without altering them. The URL and
fields necessary to complete the upload may vary between companies and
may also change over time so none of these may be hard-coded. Finally add
a field named _file_ with the actual file data.

Uploads are associated to a Company so they can use company specific
upload settings. The currently authenticated user will become the owner
of the Upload and only that user can use the Upload in subsequent
requests.

You will have to initiate the upload within one hour or you can expect
a 403 Forbidden response. Other errors are usually clearly explained in
the response body.

For an example of how to associate a finalized upload to another resource
in Procore see the Photos resource. An Upload will have to be associated
to another resource within a week or it will be automatically deleted from
Procore servers.

Note that there is also a variant of this API endpoint that works using a
Project ID.

header.description: (Required) Unique company identifier associated with the Procore User Account.

request.description: Show detailed information on an upload

request.description: Update the upload.

formdata.description:
By setting a filename you ensure that the storage service knows the
filename of the upload. Files are often downloaded directly from the
storage service and without the filename they will save on the end
users' device without a readable name or extension.

Setting this parameter is optional but highly recommended.

The content-type set through this parameter will be used by the storage
service during download just like the response_filename. Setting this
value is less important because HTTP clients and operating systems are
generally well equipped to determine file types.

Setting this parameter is optional and should only be included when you
are certain it's correct or when you want to force a content-type other
than what the filename extension suggests.

The content type set through this parameter will be used by the storage system during download, similar to the response_filename. When set to true, the file will be downloaded as an attachment. Otherwise, the file content will be rendered inline in the browser.

request.description:
Creating an Upload is the first step in associating a file to a resource
in Procore. Creating an Upload can be seen as fetching instruction on how
to post your file directly to Procore's storage service.

The instructions contain three properties: a UUID to reference the
Upload, a URL which has to be used to post the file, and fields which
need to be posted together with the file.

To upload the file you must POST to the URL in the _url_ property with
a multipart/form-data body (see RFC 2388). Make sure to include **all**
the names and values from _fields_ without altering them. The URL and
fields necessary to complete the upload may vary between companies and
may also change over time so none of these may be hard-coded. Finally add
a field named _file_ with the actual file data.

Uploads are associated to a Company so they can use company specific
upload settings. The currently authenticated user will become the owner
of the Upload and only that user can use the Upload in subsequent
requests.

You will have to initiate the upload within one hour or you can expect
a 403 Forbidden response. Other errors are usually clearly explained in
the response body.

For an example of how to associate a finalized upload to another resource
in Procore see the Photos resource. An Upload will have to be associated
to another resource within a week or it will be automatically deleted from
Procore servers.

Note that there is also a variant of this API endpoint that works using a
Project ID.

request.description:
Returns a list of the number of tasks and calendar items per project for each day in the specified date range.
Tasks and calendar items whose start - finish overlap with the specified date range are included in the sums.

query.description: (Required) Unique identifier for the company.
Page
Elements per page

The view determines which fields are returned. 'normal' returns id, address, city, country_code, division, fax, logo, name, phone, state_code, and zip.
 'extended' additionally returns main_office.

request.description: Returns a collection of Offices associated to a Company

header.description: (Required) Unique company identifier associated with the Procore User Account.

request.description:
Creates an Office associated to a Company.

#### Uploading logo
To upload an office logo you must upload whole payload as `multipart/form-data` content-type
and specify each parameter as form-data together with `office[logo]` as file.

#### Country and State codes
The `country_code` and `state_code` parameter values must conform to the ISO-3166 Alpha-2 specification.
See [Working with Country Codes](/documentation/country-codes) for additional information.

request.description:
Updates an Office associated to a Company.

#### Uploading logo
To upload an office logo you must upload whole payload as `multipart/form-data` content-type
and specify each parameter as form-data together with `office[logo]` as file.

#### Country and State codes
The `country_code` and `state_code` parameter values must conform to the ISO-3166 Alpha-2 specification.
See [Working with Country Codes](/documentation/country-codes) for additional information.

header.description: (Required) Unique company identifier associated with the Procore User Account.

request.description:
Bulk Remove Project Memberships for many parties on the given Project. Currently, the maximum number of party IDs that can be processed in a single request is 1000. If more than 1000 party IDs are provided, only the first 1000 will be processed.

This endpoint can currently only be used to remove reference users from a project. It cannot be used to remove a user who has a login or to remove vendors.

header.description: (Required) Unique company identifier associated with the Procore User Account.

query.description: Page
Elements per page

request.description:
List all Project Memberships on a given Project.

This endpoint returns all Memberships, including inactive Users/Vendors.

header.description: (Required) Unique company identifier associated with the Procore User Account.

request.description:
Create a Project Membership for a party on the given Project.

This endpoint can currently only be used to add reference users to a project. It cannot be used to add a user who has a login or to add vendors.

request.description:

This endpoint can currently only be used to delete reference users from a project. It cannot be used to delete a user who has a login or to delete vendors.

request.description:
Create a new Project Vendor.

#### Country and State codes
The `country_code` and `state_code` parameter values must conform to the ISO-3166 Alpha-2 specification.
See [Working with Country Codes](/documentation/country-codes) for additional information.

header.description: (Required) Unique company identifier associated with the Procore User Account.

query.description:
The normal view provides what is shown below.
The extended view is the same as the normal view but includes children_count, legal_name, parent, and bidding.
The default view is normal.

request.description: Show detail on a specified Project Vendor.

header.description: (Required) Unique company identifier associated with the Procore User Account.

body.raw:
{
  "vendor": {
    "abbreviated_name": "<string>",
    "address": "<string>",
    "authorized_bidder": "<boolean>",
    "business_phone": "<string>",
    "city": "<string>",
    "country_code": "<string>",
    "email_address": "<string>",
    "fax_number": "<string>",
    "is_active": "<boolean>",
    "labor_union": "<string>",
    "license_number": "<string>",
    "mobile_phone": "<string>",
    "name": "<string>",
    "non_union_prevailing_wage": "<boolean>",
    "notes": "<string>",
    "origin_id": "<string>",
    "origin_data": "<string>",
    "origin_code": "<string>",
    "parent_id": "<integer>",
    "prequalified": false,
    "primary_contact_id": "<integer>",
    "state_code": "<string>",
    "trade_name": "<string>",
    "union_member": "<boolean>",
    "website": "<string>",
    "zip": "<string>",
    "bidding": {
      "affirmative_action": false,
      "small_business": false,
      "african_american_business": false,
      "hispanic_business": false,
      "womens_business": false,
      "historically_underutilized_business": false,
      "sdvo_business": false,
      "certified_business_enterprise": false,
      "asian_american_business": false,
      "native_american_business": false,
      "disadvantaged_business": false,
      "minority_business_enterprise": false,
      "eight_a_business": false
    }
  }
}

Specifies which view of the resource to return (which attributes should be present in the response). Users without read permissions to Directory are limited to the compact view. Otherwise, the default view is normal.

Return item(s) created within the specified ISO 8601 datetime range.
Formats:
`YYYY-MM-DD`...`YYYY-MM-DD` - Date
`YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`...`YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ` - DateTime with UTC Offset
`YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+XX:00...`YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+XX:00` - Datetime with Custom Offset

Return item(s) last updated within the specified ISO 8601 datetime range.
Formats:
`YYYY-MM-DD`...`YYYY-MM-DD` - Date
`YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`...`YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ` - DateTime with UTC Offset
`YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+XX:00`...`YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+XX:00` - Datetime with Custom Offset
Permission Template ID. Returns item(s) assiociated with the specified Permission Template ID.
Return item(s) with the specified Vendor IDs.
Origin ID. Returns item(s) with the specified Origin ID.
Returns users whose vendor record is associated with the specified trade id(s).
Returns users whose vendor record is associated with the specified trade id(s).
Returns users where the search string matches the user's first name, last name, email address, keywords, job title, or company name
Returns users whose is_employee attribute matches the parameter.
Returns users whose id attribute matches the parameter.
Returns items with the specified sort.

request.description:
Returns a list of active users associated with a project.

See [Filtering on List Actions](https://developers.procore.com/documentation/filtering-on-list-actions) for information on using the filtering capabilities provided by this endpoint.

request.description:
Creates a new user in the specified project.

#### Country and State codes
The `country_code` and `state_code` parameter values must conform to the ISO-3166 Alpha-2 specification.
See [Working with Country Codes](/documentation/country-codes) for additional information.

#### Created Response
For null values, the key won't be returned

query.description: If true, validations are run for the corresponding Configurable Field Set.

request.description:
Updates the specified project user. The `country_code` and `state_code` parameter values must conform to the ISO-3166 Alpha-2 specification.
See [Working with Country Codes](/documentation/country-codes) for additional information. For OK responses with null values, the key will not be returned.

Note: The `is_active` parameter value requires
a boolean value to be passed in. Setting this parameter to false deactivates the user.
If you have deactivated a user by setting `is_active` to false and then try to
reactivate the user by setting `is_active` to true, you will receive an error message.
To reactivate the user via API, you need to call the
[Sync Company Users](/reference/rest/v1/company-users#sync-company-users) method.

header.description: (Required) Unique company identifier associated with the Procore User Account.

Page
Elements per page
If true, returns item(s) where `is_employee` value is true.
If true, returns only people who are reference users.
If true, returns only people who are not reference users.

If true, returns people in the Company not just the Project. This option only works if the user has permission to create people in the project directory or permission to read from the company directory.
Returns item(s) matching the specified search query string.
If true, returns only people who are connected users. If false, returns only people who are not connected users.

Returns only people who have the specified job title.
Returns only people who have the specified country code.
Returns only people who have the specified state code.
Array of Trade IDs. Returns item(s) with the specified Trade IDs.
Array of Permission Template IDs. Returns item(s) with the specified Permission Template IDs.
Return items with the specified sort

Parameter affecting what level of detail will be returned from the endpoint. 'extended' will include the users included in each distribution group.

Parameter affecting the scope for the Distribution Groups, by default is 'false' to only return the Distribution Groups at Project level. Setting it to 'true' will also include Distribution Groups at Company level.

Parameter affecting the scope for the Distribution Groups, by default it is the Domain ID of the Submittals Tool. Will return only Distributions Groups who users that have access to the Tool specified by the domain_id. Only applies to requests that also have include_ancestors set to 'true'.

Parameter affecting the scope for the Distribution Groups, by default it is the 'read' user access level. Will return only Distributions Groups who users that have the min ual specified by the 'min_ual'. Only applies to requests that also have include_ancestors set to 'true'.

item.name: List Project Names for a Company User

header.description: (Required) Unique company identifier associated with the Procore User Account.

request.description: This endpoint returns the list of Project Names for the specified User. This includes the names of Projects that the User is currently assigned to, as well as the names of Projects that the User is not currently assigned to.

item.name: List Project Numbers for a Company User

header.description: (Required) Unique company identifier associated with the Procore User Account.

request.description: This endpoint returns the list of Project Numbers for the specified User. This includes the numbers of Projects that the User is currently assigned to, as well as the numbers of Projects that the User is not currently assigned to.

item.name: List Project Stages for a Company User

header.description: (Required) Unique company identifier associated with the Procore User Account.

request.description: This endpoint returns the list of Project Stages for the specified User. This includes the stages of Projects that the User is currently assigned to, as well as the stages of Projects that the User is not currently assigned to.

item.name: List Permission Templates for a Company User

header.description: (Required) Unique company identifier associated with the Procore User Account.

request.description: This endpoint returns the list of Permission Templates for the specified User. This includes the templates of Projects that the User is currently assigned to, as well as the templates of Projects that the User is not currently assigned to.

item.name: List Programs for a Company User

header.description: (Required) Unique company identifier associated with the Procore User Account.

request.description: This endpoint returns the list of Programs for the specified User. This includes the programs of Projects that the User is currently assigned to, as well as the programs of Projects that the User is not currently assigned to.

item.name: List Regions for a Company User

header.description: (Required) Unique company identifier associated with the Procore User Account.

request.description: This endpoint returns the list of Regions for the specified User. This includes the regions of Projects that the User is currently assigned to, as well as the regions of Projects that the User is not currently assigned to.

item.name: List Roles for a Company User

header.description: (Required) Unique company identifier associated with the Procore User Account.

request.description: This endpoint returns the list of Roles for the specified User. This includes the roles of Projects that the User is currently assigned to, as well as the roles of Projects that the User is not currently assigned to.

item.name: List Project Types for a Company User

header.description: (Required) Unique company identifier associated with the Procore User Account.

request.description: This endpoint returns the list of Project Types for the specified User. This includes the types of Projects that the User is currently assigned to, as well as the types of Projects that the User is not currently assigned to.
